instructions: Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 1 1 Open your PlayStore. Each tablet or mobile contains this feature. It is the icon that represents a bag with a light blue and orange triangle on it. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 2 2 Tap the search bar. Type in "Dolphin Browser". Many results will appear here. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 3 3 Click on the first option. It will be a white dolphin on a green with a square background. When the page for installation appears, click on the "INSTALL" option beside the icon. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 4 4 Wait for the app to install. It takes at least 3-7 minutes. After it is installed, it will appear on your home-screen. Advertisement

Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 5 1 Click on the browser. It will appear after a few seconds on your screen. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 6 2 Click on the search engine at the top of the screen. It will be below the tabs you've opened. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 7 3 Search anything you want to. On your keyboard, press "Go", "Enter" or "Search". Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 8 4 On the tab you've opened, a small circle will appear, moving round. Your web results will appear when the circle stops moving. Advertisement

Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 9 1 Swipe your finger from the left side of the screen to the right. A sidebar list will appear. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 10 2 Click on the Incognito Mode option. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 11 3 Wait for a black screen to appear. There will be a spy at the corner of your screen. In the middle of it, you will see what the incognito mode is and what it's not. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 12 4 Click on the Search engine. Type in whatever you like and tap on "Go". Your wanted website will appear. The incognito mode won't save the history. Advertisement

Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 13 1 Swipe your finger from the left of the screen to the right. The side bar will open. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 14 2 Tap the "Add Bookmark" option along the top of the side bar. You will have bookmarked the page. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 15 3 Tap any of the bookmarks on the side bar. This will take you to any pages you have bookmarked. Advertisement

Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 16 1 Swipe your finger from left to right. This will open the Add-Ons toolbar. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 17 2 Tap at "Get More Add-Ons". This is located on the top of the Add-Ons toolbar. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 18 3 Tap on the "Search" text field displayed to search for Dolphin Browser Add-Ons. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 19 4 Tap "Install" on the Add-Ons detail page. You have started installing the Add-On you wish for. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 20 5 Tap any of the Add-Ons that are in the Add-Ons toolbar to access its functions and settings. Advertisement

Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 21 1 Tap Menu in the Dolphin browser. Select More, . Tap on settings. Settings, . Then tap on the Dolphin Settings and select Set Dolphin as Default Browser to make Dolphin the default browser on your Android device. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 22 2 Tap Menu in the Dolphin browser. Now select More, . Tap on Settings, and select Data Storage Settings .Click on Browsing Without History to browse without history using Dolphin. Image titled Use Dolphin Browser for Android Step 23 3 Tap Menu in the Dolphin browser. Then select Data Storage Settings and tap Clear Data to clear your cache. This will also eliminate cookies and browsing history. Advertisement
